title: 105_hr120
content:
The Act titled "Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997" includes definitions. Section 101 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to make various changes to definitions within the bankruptcy law. This includes adjustments to paragraph numbers, terminology, and punctuation. SEC. 3. ADJUSTMENT OF DOLLAR AMOUNTS. Section 104 of title 11, United States Code, is amended by inserting ``522(f)(3),'' after ``522(d),'' each place it appears. SEC. 4. EXTENSION OF TIME. Section 108(c)(2) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by striking ``922'' and all that follows through ``or'', and inserting ``922, 1201, or''. SEC. 5. PENALTY FOR PERSONS WHO NEGLIGENTLY OR FRAUDULENTLY PREPARE BANKRUPTCY PETITIONS. Section 110(j)(3) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by striking ``attorney's'' and inserting ``attorneys' ''. SEC. 6. ELIGIBILITY TO SERVE AS TRUSTEE. Paragraphs (1) and (2) of section 321(a) of title 11, United States Code, are amended by striking ``7, 12,'' and inserting ``12''. SEC. 7. EMPLOYMENT OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. Section 327 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to clarify the authority of the Trustee and limit compensation. Subsection (b) is updated to include chapter 721, subsection (c) now includes chapters 7, 12, or, and subsection (d) specifies professional services. Section 328(b) is amended to replace "serve as an attorney or accountant" with "render professional services" and adjust language regarding compensation. Section 327 of title 11, United States Code is amended to clarify the authority of the Trustee and limit compensation for professional services. The amendment replaces references to "attorney or accountant" with "professional person" to specify the type of services provided. SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON COMPENSATION OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. Amends Section 328(a) of title 11, United States Code to include compensation "on a fixed or percentage fee basis."

SEC. 7. COMPENSATION TO OFFICERS. Amends Section 330(a) of title 11, United States Code to specify compensation for officers and the debtor's attorney.

SEC. 8. SPECIAL TAX PROVISIONS. Amends Section 346(g)(1)(C) of title 11, United States Code by removing certain tax provisions.

SEC. 9. EFFECT OF CONVERSION. Amends Section 348(f)(2) of title 11, United States Code to clarify the effect of conversion on property of the estate.

SEC. 10. AUTOMATIC STAY. SEC. 11. EXECUTORY CONTRACTS AND UNEXPIRED LEASES. Section 348(f)(2) of title 11, United States Code is amended to clarify the effect of conversion on property of the estate. Section 362 of title 11, United States Code is further amended regarding security interests and entities. Section 365 of title 11, United States Code is amended to include provisions related to the satisfaction of penalty rates in contracts and leases, as well as default arising from nonmonetary obligations. Subsection (c) is also amended to clarify the effect of conversion on property of the estate and security interests. In section 365 of title 11, United States Code, amendments are made to address penalty rates in contracts, default from nonmonetary obligations, and the effect of conversion on property and security interests. Amendments include striking certain paragraphs and inserting periods for clarity. SEC. 12. AMENDMENT TO TABLE OF SECTIONS. Amends the item relating to section 556 regarding contractual rights to liquidate commodities contracts or forward contracts. SEC. 13. ALLOWANCE OF ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. Amends section 503(b)(4) to include subparagraphs before paragraph (3). SEC. 14. PRIORITIES. Amends section 507(a) by adjusting punctuation and adding "unsecured" after "allowed." SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. Amends section 522 of title 11, United States Code, regarding liabilities and support. Section 523 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include new provisions related to debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor. Additionally, subsection (a)(17) is modified to specify that certain debts can be imposed on a prisoner by a Federal court. In subsection (e), the amendment corrects a typographical error by changing "a insured" to "an insured". SEC. 17. Amendment to Section 524(a)(3) of title 11, United States Code regarding discharge effects.

SEC. 18. Amendment to Section 525(c) of title 11, United States Code for protection against discriminatory treatment.

SEC. 19. Amendment to Section 541(b)(4)(B)(ii) of title 11, United States Code regarding property of the estate.

SEC. 20. Limitations on avoiding powers. SEC. 20. LIMITATIONS ON AVOIDING POWERS. Section 546 of title 11, United States Code, is amended by redesignating the second subsection (g) as subsection (h). SEC. 21. LIABILITY OF TRANSFEREE OF AVOIDED TRANSFER. SEC. 21 amends Section 550(c) of title 11, United States Code, regarding the liability of transferee of avoided transfers. It clarifies the recoveries from a transferee not an insider at the time of transfer. SEC. 22 addresses setoff. SEC. 22 amends Section 553(b)(1) of title 11, United States Code, by changing the reference from "362(b)(14)" to "362(b)(17)". Section 901(a) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by inserting ``1123(d),'' after ``1123(b),''. Section 1104(b) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to address the appointment of an elected trustee, outlining the process and resolution of disputes. SEC. 26. ABANDONMENT OF RAILROAD LINE.

SEC. 27. CONTENTS OF PLAN.

SEC. 28. PAYMENTS.

SEC. 29. DISCHARGE.

SEC. 30. CONTENTS OF PLAN. SEC. 30. CONTENTS OF PLAN. Section 1322 of title 11, United States Code, is amended by changing subsection (b) to (d) and subsection (e) by removing a comma after "default". SEC. 32. Amendments to Section 1334(d) of title 28, United States Code, regarding bankruptcy cases and proceedings. SEC. 33. Amendments to Section 604 of the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1994. SEC. 34. Knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. SEC. 34. Knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. Amendments made to Section 156(a) of title 18, United States Code, regarding the terms "bankruptcy" and "document" in relation to title 11. SEC. 35. Effective Date; Application of Amendments. This Act and its amendments will take effect on the enactment date, with the amendments applying to cases under title 11 of the United States Code initiated after the enactment date.
